I really hate people who don't know technology.

That's gotta be the DUMBEST thing I've heard said on here in awhile, LOL. It's 720p because you have 1280 pixels going across in width. 544 is just the container height after the top and bottom black bars are cropped. Only tv groups leave their 720p res intact at 1280x720. 1280x544 is HD-ready at a 1:2.35 aspect ratio (anamorphic widescreen -> usually remastering old movies with a 4:3 aspect ratio to be able to view correctly on a widescreen television).

1280x720 is HD-Ready at a 16:9 aspect ratio (widescreen)
1920x1080 is Full HD at a 19:9 aspect ratio (widescreen)

So to answer your question, yes, 1280x544 is 720p. If you care to expand your knowledge on this subject you might wanna skidoodle on over to this site...

http://www.widescreen.org/widescreen.shtml

Have fun! =)
